introduction.description: St. Paul has a rich paranormal history, with numerous haunted locations dating back to the city's founding
introduction.significance: Victorian-era architecture, tragic history, and preservation efforts have maintained many allegedly haunted sites

haunted_locations.name: Wabasha Street Caves

ghosts.name: Unknown gangster
ghosts.description: Believed to be a gangster killed during Prohibition

haunted_locations.history: Used as speakeasy and nightclub "Castle Royal" during Prohibition, frequented by gangsters like John Dillinger

haunted_locations.name: Landmark Center (Old Federal Courts Building)

ghosts.name: Unknown prisoner
ghosts.description: Believed to be a prisoner who died in the building's cells

ghosts.name: Unknown judge or court official
manifestations: Papers rustling when rooms are empty

haunted_locations.history: Housed federal courts where gangsters were tried, had jail cells in basement

haunted_locations.name: Forepaugh's Restaurant (Joseph Lybrandt Forepaugh House)

ghosts.name: Molly (housemaid)
ghosts.description: Young Irish housemaid who allegedly had affair with Joseph Forepaugh

ghosts.name: Joseph Lybrandt Forepaugh
ghosts.description: Wealthy businessman who committed suicide months after Molly's death

haunted_locations.history: Forepaugh was prominent businessman, mansion fell into disrepair before restoration as restaurant (1976)
paranormal_activity: Staff and diners report ghost sightings

haunted_locations.name: Fitzgerald Theater (Old Shubert Theater)

ghosts.name: Ben (stagehand)
ghosts.description: Believed to be friendly ghost who protects performers and staff

haunted_locations.history: Historic vaudeville theater, later home of "A Prairie Home Companion"

haunted_locations.name: Saint Paul Hotel

ghosts.name: Charles Wade
ghosts.description: Businessman murdered in hotel during gangster era

haunted_locations.history: Luxury hotel frequented by gangsters, politicians, and wealthy travelers
paranormal_activity: Elevator going to floors without being called

haunted_locations.name: James J. Hill House

ghosts.name: Mary Hill (James J. Hill's wife)
ghosts.description: Mary Hill died in the house, some say she never left

haunted_locations.history: 36,000 sq ft mansion of railroad baron James J. Hill

haunted_locations.name: Griggs Mansion (now demolished)
haunted_locations.history: Series of tragedies befell the Griggs family
haunted_locations.curse_description: Family experienced multiple deaths, financial ruin, and misfortune
haunted_locations.legacy: Local legend of cursed Summit Avenue mansion

haunted_locations.name: Mounds Park

ghosts.name: Native American spirits
ghosts.description: Spirits of those buried in the mounds

haunted_locations.history: Contains 6 remaining prehistoric burial mounds (16-18 originally)

urban_legends.name: The Swede Hollow Ghost
urban_legends.legend: Ghosts of former Swedish, Italian, and Mexican immigrants seen in the hollow
urban_legends.history: Poor immigrant neighborhood demolished, residents forcibly relocated

urban_legends.name: The Woman in White (Oakland Cemetery)
urban_legends.legend: Woman in Victorian white dress searching for lost child
urban_legends.description: Apparition of woman in white wandering among graves at night

urban_legends.name: The Mississippi River Ghosts
legends: Homeless people who died in caves

halloween_events.name: Wabasha Street Caves Halloween Tours
halloween_events.description: Special haunted cave tours in October

halloween_events.name: Historic Ghost Walk
halloween_events.description: Walking tour of downtown haunted locations
